title:
The Creeping Spider
Day by day-that Spider woves its webbings.
I can here it- I can hear it creeping...

attachments.displayName:
The Creeping Spider
Day by day-that Spider woves its webbings.
I can here it- I can hear it creeping around
the sounds it's feet makes as it move make
me sick.
The way it looks at me with its thick furry head and
it's little eyes, welcomes its prey to a nasty surprise.
Day by day it walks around catching its prey and eating them, their remains I always found...
The acursed thing, I never wanted to see but She needed a home-a home with me... why me-why me. Maybe she choose me
I hear it-I hear it-I hope I am not going insane, I thought in my head as it creeped near me around the head of my bed- I opened my eyes and gave out a shout.
"You acursed thing! "What do you want-want do you want",I waited as if I was expecting a reply, she stared at me as if shy than she gave a eerie grin.
She never replied to me but I could see-she loved me. The very thing I hated so never wanted to let me go.
Why-why I thought to my self before catching a glace at my shelf- to my horror I saw: big webs, small webs, little webs tall webs, all with eaten prey every where around my house. It was on my doors my walls even the floor.
I ran to my front door never looking back then I stopped. My front door was webbed shut and I could not get out, what its going on I wondered trying to find a way out but there was no escape. No escaping her affection.
I yelled "Day by day I watched you prey on innocent little lives always with your nasty surprise,but me-out of all of them,I said. I thought you loved me- why are you doing this to me why can't I be free than suddenly she appeared before me.
Hanging from her webs-she had those eyes-those same motherly eyes which she glares
at her prey with... right before her nasty surprise.
All the walls had prey wrapped up and now Im trapped to inside my own home no.. no.. not my home her home...
I was the intruder all along listening to the sounds of her love song,her one and only love bee she caught in her web of admiration. I thought to myself "am I her prey that is next to die to day?" but in her heart-she thought: (Day by day...Day by day...My beloved, you will be my only 'lover' not just prey. You lived alone everyday and no one cared about you-all they did was stare and doubt you, but not me-no I will protect you, your home outside and in I covered in web that, I did. your mine forever..I got you)

object.content:
The Creeping Spider
Day by day-that Spider woves its webbings.
I can here it- I can hear it creeping around
the sounds it's feet makes as it move make
me sick. 
The way it looks at me with its thick furry head and 
it's little eyes, welcomes its prey to a nasty surprise.
Day by day it walks around catching its prey and eating them, their remains I always found...
The acursed thing, I never wanted to see but She needed a home-a home with me... why me-why me. Maybe she choose me

Why-why I thought to my self before catching a glace at my shelf- to my horror I saw: big webs, small webs, little webs tall webs, all with eaten prey every where around my house. It was on my doors my walls even the floor.   
I ran to my front door never looking back then I stopped. My front door was webbed shut and I could not get out, what its going on I wondered trying to find a way out but there was no escape. No escaping her affection.

Hanging from her webs-she had those eyes-those same motherly eyes which she glares

All the walls had prey wrapped up and now Im trapped to inside my own home no.. no.. not my home her home...

I thought to myself "am I her prey that is next to die to day?" but in her heart-she thought: (Day by day...Day by day...My beloved, you will be my only 'lover' not just prey. You lived alone everyday and no one cared about you-all they did was stare and doubt you, but not me-no I will protect you, your home outside and in I covered in web that, I did. your mine forever..I got you)
